Term.Comment: Event for an HTTP request and response
Event that represents a single clickstream page view
The HTTP status code returned to the client
The Content-Type HTTP request header
Page title, extracted from HTML content
Response content (normally HTML) for the http-event which triggered the new page-event
The HTTP status message returned to the client
The HTTP method of the request (GET, POST, etc.)
The requested resource (including query)
The requested resource (excluding query)
The query portion of the requested resource
The parameters portion of the requested resource
A urlencoded string representing all form data fields
The request line exactly as it came from the client
The Host HTTP request header
The Referer HTTP request header
The User-Agent HTTP request header
The Set-Cookie HTTP response header
The Content-Type HTTP response header
HTTP request content length
HTTP response content length
The Location HTTP response header
All HTTP headers sent from client to server
All HTTP headers sent from server to client
HTTP request content sent from client to server
HTTP response content sent from server to client
The protocol version that the client used
Number of page views associated with a visitor session
Number of HTTP requests associated with a visitor session
Number of seconds spent viewing all pages within a visitor session
Number of seconds between the first and last session requests
New visitor: how determined? c=Cookie, v=visitorDB, a=anonDB
1 if the http-event triggered the generation of a new page
1 if the (http or page) event triggered the generation of a new visitor session
1 if the http event matched the page object detection rules
Number of microseconds that it took to load a page view
Number of microseconds that it took redirecting a page view
Number of microseconds that it took loading a page's HTML
Number of microseconds that it took loading a page's content
The username as which the user has authenticated himself
1 if the response was cached, 0 if it was not
Event that represents a single clickstream visitor session
Clickstream session group this event was assigned to
Unique identifier assigned to the clickstream visitor session
Unique identifier assigned to the visitor (across sessions)
Unique identifier assigned to a http request (in storage)
Cookie identifier used for sessionizing clickstream ("name:value")
Page sequence number, or total number of pages found for session events
Request sequence number, or total number of requests for session and page view events
The Cookie HTTP request header
The remote logname of the user
1 if the event was generated by a robot visitor, undefined if it was not
Number of HTTP requests associated with the page view
Number of seconds spent viewing a completed page view
Unique identifier assigned to a doc(page content) in text index
The Internet service name and instance number that was running on the client
The name of the server on which the log file entry was generated
The HTTP substatus error code
The Windows status code
ContentStorage compressed
IP address of the client in dot-quad notation. Contains the value of X-Forwarded-For header or equal to flow.c-ip is X-Forwarded-For is not set.
The Content-Location HTTP response header. An alternate location for the returned data.
The Transfer-Encoding HTTP response header. The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.
The Accept HTTP request header. Content-Types that are acceptable for the response.
The Server HTTP response header. A name for the server.
The Allow HTTP response header. Valid actions for a specified resource. To be used for a 405 Method not allowed.
Connection type desired by the sender for that particular connection.
Information related to the disposition of the content present on the web page.
Name of uploaded file if content-type is multipart.
Contains content encoding format.
The X-Forwarded-For HTTP header. IP Address of client that initiated the request and subsequent proxies in a chain of proxies.
User attribute of the NTLM protocol.
Domain attribute of the NTLM protocol.
Workstation attribute of the NTLM protocol.
Authentication type on the proxy (Basic - Digest - NTLM).
Login used for proxy authentication.
Authentication type used.
The set of natural languages that are preferred as a response to the request.
The natural language or languages of the intended audience for the enclosed entity.
Implementation specific directives from client to server.
Implementation specific directives from server to client.
Directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms from client to server.
Directives that MUST be obeyed by all caching mechanisms from server to client.
The date/time after which the response is considered stale.
The sender's estimate of the amount of time since the response was generated at the origin server.
The current value of the entity tag for the requested variant.
The date and time at which the request was originated.
The date and time at which the response was originated.
Used for storing the incrementally computed MD5 hash of http.cs-content.
Used for storing the incrementally computed MD5 hash of http.sc-content.
Size of extracted file(only set if file extraction is turned on)
Content type of the request or the web page
Name of uploaded file
